name: rykan
text: A comment left by rykan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by plummet, lordofring, ESwrathwright, trisha, kingkhanandbbq, fattypneumonia)

name: anticitizen
text: "Try the veal, everybody, tip your waitresses."

name: nabeel84
text: Roast Beef looking jacked.

name: ganymedeio
text: By comparison, I suppose.

name: epicurus
text:
I love Ray saying "Verily, as did I."

Now every time I hear The Boys are Back in Town this is all I think of; my mind runs an endless loop of the guys jumping over the couch.

name: spinynorman
text: Yeah, but keep in mind, using antiquarian language to discuss trim outside of Achewood isn't going to garner much respect from anyone you want to spend more than fifteen seconds with.

name: epicurus
text:
Have to disagree on that one, SN. What about time travelling victorian inventors? Especially the attractive female ones?

Johdpurs!

name: belgand
text: No... I like it with the goggles on.

name: tangles
text: victorian   female = more fainting couch, less inventing. unless she's a crazy queen or noble. then it's all fun, till she gets angry at you and has you drawn and quartered

name: gunsofray
text: hung[/i[ drawn and quartered.. you gotta get it [i]right .. or at least that that ass first.

name: gunsofray
text: I.. I don't know how this happened, I am sorry.

name: terribleman
text: I kinda liked it. Gotta get that ass first!

name: mercuri0us
text: You know this from personal experience?

name: nurdbot
text: This was THE arc that got me into the comic. Somebody on Superdickery posted it in the forums.

name: saint
text: ray wants to give women what they want...particularly more children.

name: centipede_damascus
text: We just have to remember

name: cuddlepaw
text: Fuckin' Descartes right there.

name: falseprophet
text: The new saying is "I think, therefore, I am. I remember...verily, I remember. "

name: charchar
text:
" Je pense, donce je suis. Je me souvenis...en effet, je me souvenis "

Descartes originally said this is French, not Latin but it was the 17th century after all .

I also needed to translate something into French without availing myself to orthographic marks.

name: chaesar
text: A comment left by chaesar was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by scion, jargonmaster, scraggg)

name: c_dizzle
text: Before this strip, I had only associated that word with The Scarlet Letter. I can now go back to using it without feeling like a vain Victorian nobleman.

name: kamet
text: I think it's especially great that RAY is using "verily"... from Teodor, I might expect, but Mr. Smuckles? Nay.

name: dj_insomniac
text: Completely off-topic, that must be the greatest Avatar ever produced, Kamet. I miss the Pink Panther.

name: scion
text: Chubby for noting that your comment was off-topic. Also, I miss that darned cat too.

name: scion
text: Call it "The Appendage Effect": even a lout like Ray becomes a gentleman and a scholar with one of those weights on his crotch.

name: imitationcrab
text: They're all jumping in slow motion in my mind... just having a great old time

name: awko
text: It'd be in real time, but as they reach the apex of their leap, freeze frame, fade out, roll credits.

name: biznart
text: Would Thin Lizzy continue playing, or would it switch to the Night Court theme music?

name: rhymesforkids
text: fantastic. that's also the perfect song for having fun!

name: jerkface
text: I've been reading Achewood for the past week starting from the beginning, and it really turned a corner after GOF, to go down the hall of completely awesome.

name: relaxing
text: TOMORROW: The January, 2006 issue of Cosmo.

name: stuntman
text: i cannot think of a song better for this occasion than said song

name: killingthejay
text: chips are good.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: it is so fun to be with the dudes

name: jandruff
text: It's funny that as they are in touch with their primitive selves, they speak with a more proper diction than usual.

name: saru
text: I love that despite having huge sexual organs, our ancestors didn't make prolific use of them. Indeed, mating only for procreation. I guess that they don't need to do the job that often, getting it done right every time.

name: agentj
text: A comment left by agentj was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, nathanielperson, kochipoik)

name: dumase
text:
I'm just getting into Achewood, reading all the way back from the beginning. And as such, i've seen several thousand comments saying "THIS is my favorite story arc"
And i will admit, it has sort of gotten annoying.

But goddamn, if this arc is not my favorite arc. I mean, it's about foil underwear with simulated extended wangs. Like, i don't even know.

name: kenyot
text: Ladies and Gentlemen, the new dirtiest dudes in town trio!

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Ray: I got to quit settin' myself up for a disaster.
Pat: Back to Trader Joe's.

name: terribleman
text: Wow, these are two long ones. Ray's is hilarious, and Pat's has Nice Pete's van in it.

name: mulisha7
text: Verily, I gave this strip the 5 it most assuredly desserved.

name: taiiga
text: Seriously, this can all be equated to a solid LSD trip, the feeling of liberation from ego, the want to return to a simpler, more primal time of human history, the feeling of just being a small part of a massive, balanced system of which one individual is no consequence to.. all of these feelings can be brought forth when we unlock the psychedelic key to our own souls.

name: strix22
text: Why, I would have to agree.

name: rowboat
text:
You describe the Hollywood idea of tripping.

In reality it's more like endlessly darting back and forth between the room without people in it and the room with people in it over and over again, never being able to decide which is more sad and terrifying. That, or you just giggle like a moron for six hours and then pass out for another twelve.

For something which used to be quite dear to my heart, I really do not miss acid.

name: unsentletter
text: Ahhh.  Bliss.

name: saligamachine
text: this story arc is genius

name: avery86
text: Notice the varying sizes of the objects placed in the holders, with Ray's being the biggest.

name: deptford
text: The last panel is an absolute good.

name: biiaru
text:
When I visited the Achewood website for the very first time many years ago, this is the strip I saw.

Oh, memories. I came in during good times.

name: hamscout
text:
I am beginning to doubt the power of the ding-a-ling armature.

Reading a stale Cosmopolitan is a poor approximation of a woman's company.

You know they just read the "Top ten bedroom tips to drive your man WILD" , and tossed it back on the table...

name: srikamaraja
text: This is what I will do in Heaven.

text: does this work irl?
